sentence.Network_en: They stigmatize these propositions as " trifling " or " merely verbal ".
sentence.Network_cn: 他们把这些命题贬称为 “ 琐碎 ” 或 “ 只是咬文嚼字罢了 ”.
他们把这些命题贬称 “ 琐碎”.

sentence.Network_en: Deportation is especially hard on women from societies that stigmatize divorce.
sentence.Network_cn: 对于那些来自视离婚为耻辱的国度的妇女来说,被驱逐出境对她们尤其艰难.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the sense 'mark with a brand'): from French stigmatiser or medieval Latin stigmatizare, from Greek stigmatizein, from stigma (see stigma)

entry.def: If someone or something is stigmatized, they are unfairly regarded by many people as being bad or having something to be ashamed of.

example.ex: Children in single-parent families must not be stigmatised...
example.tran: 单亲家庭的孩子们不应该受到歧视。

example.ex: The AIDS epidemic further stigmatised gays...
example.tran: 艾滋病的流行让人们更加瞧不起男同性恋者。

means.word_mean: 1. to accuse or condemn or openly or formally or brand as disgraceful;

sentences.sentence: "She was stigmatized by society because she had a child out of wedlock"

means.word_mean: 2. mark with a stigma or stigmata;

stems_affixes.word_buile: a无+stigma标志,斑点+tic……的→看不到污点→散光的
stigma标志,斑点→n.耻辱,污点,污名
stigma标志,斑点+tize=ize表动词→给别人污点→玷污

sentences.en: He was stigmatized as an ex-convict.
sentences.cn: 他遭人污辱,说他给判过刑。
